description: Students explored local ecosystems through hands-on field research, collecting water samples and studying native plant species along the Columbia River.
A robotics program that introduced students to coding and engineering principles through building and programming competitive robots.
Interactive art installation project where students created murals depicting Hood River's cultural diversity and agricultural heritage.
Farm-to-table cooking program teaching students about nutrition, sustainable agriculture, and culinary skills using local ingredients.
Outdoor education program providing students with wilderness survival skills, orienteering, and environmental stewardship training.
Music technology lab where students learned digital music production, sound engineering, and composition using professional software.
